channel.title: How to install wine?
channel.description:
So i tried both of these guides because they were for debian https://tecadmin.net/install-wine-debian-9-stretch/ https://tecadmin.net/install-wine-on-debian-10-buster/
however when i enter: sudo apt-add-repository https://dl.winehq.org/wine-builds/debian/ i get: sudo: apt-add-repository: command not found
and on sudo apt-get install --install-recommends winehq-stable i get: Unable to locate package winehq-stable
I know i'm missing some whonix specific step, help would be much apreciated.

item.title: How to install wine?
item.dc:creator: madaidan
item.description:
want2know:

and on sudo apt-get install --install-recommends winehq-stable
i get:
Unable to locate package winehq-stable

You can use apt search to search for a specific package name if you didn’t get it exactly right.

For example, in your usecase, you can look for packages with “wine” in the name by running sudo apt search wine. This helps when you don’t know the exact name of the package.

Read full topic

item.title: How to install wine?
item.dc:creator: 0brand
item.description:
Hi want2know

FYI

want2know:

however when i enter: sudo apt-add-repository https://dl.winehq.org/wine-builds/debian/
i get:
sudo: apt-add-repository: command not found

When a command throws an error you can usually find an solution by searching for the error with a search engine.

For example, searching for keywords (in duckduckgo):

“sudo: apt-add-repository: command not found”

Returns this answer.

https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/45879/how-to-add-repository-from-shell-in-debian

sudo apt-get install software-properties-common

Read full topic

item.title: How to install wine?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
No extra repositories should be required.

sudo apt-get install wine without any other commands should install it.

See also:

Whonix

Install Software

Installing additional Software on Whonix ™. Safety considerations.

Read full topic

item.title: How to install wine?
item.dc:creator: want2know
item.description:
dnull from the forum helped me so for the future generations:

we open the foulder sources.list.d with the command :
sudo nano /etc/apt/sources.list.d/wine.list
we type in or copy paste: deb https://dl.winehq.org/wine-builds/debian/ stretch main
ctrl+x to exit Y to save
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install wine

Read full topic

item.title: How to install wine?
item.dc:creator: want2know
item.description:
So i tried both of these guides because they were for debian

TecAdmin – 23 Dec 18

How To Install Wine 4 on Debian 9 (Stretch) – TecAdmin

The Winehq team has announced the latest stable release 4.0 on May 15, 2019. Its source code is available for download from its official site. You may also use the package manager to install wine. Wine is an Open Source implementation of the Windows...


TecAdmin – 26 May 19

How To Install Wine 4 on Debian 10 (Buster) Linux – TecAdmin

How To Install Wine 4 on Debian 10 . This article will help you to install Wine 4.0 Stable Release on Debian 10 Buster Linux system.

however when i enter: sudo apt-add-repository https://dl.winehq.org/wine-builds/debian/
i get:
sudo: apt-add-repository: command not found

and on sudo apt-get install --install-recommends winehq-stable
i get:
Unable to locate package winehq-stable

I know i’m missing some whonix specific step, help would be much apreciated.

Read full topic
